studyArms.name: Arm A: Palbociclib + Fulvestrant
studyArms.description: Patients receive palbociclib 125 mg/day orally for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off, plus fulvestrant 500 mg intramuscularly on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, and every 28 days thereafter.

studyArms.name: Arm B: Placebo + Fulvestrant
studyArms.description: Patients receive placebo orally daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off, plus fulvestrant 500 mg intramuscularly on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, and every 28 days thereafter.

studyCohorts.name: Pre-/peri-menopausal women
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who are pre- or peri-menopausal at study entry and receive the LHRH agonist goserelin in addition to their assigned randomized treatment.

studyCohorts.name: Post-menopausal women
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who are post-menopausal at study entry.

studyDesign.name: Study Design
stratificationFactors: documented sensitivity to prior hormonal therapy (yes vs. no)
menopausal status at study entry (pre-/peri- vs. post menopausal)
presence of visceral metastases (yes vs. no)
documented sensitivity to prior hormonal therapy (yes vs. no)
menopausal status at study entry (pre-/peri- vs. post menopausal)
presence of visceral metastases (yes vs. no)

arms.name: Arm A: Palbociclib + Fulvestrant
arms.description: Patients receive palbociclib 125 mg/day orally for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off, plus fulvestrant 500 mg intramuscularly on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, and every 28 days thereafter.

arms.name: Arm B: Placebo + Fulvestrant
arms.description: Patients receive placebo orally daily for 3 weeks followed by 1 week off, plus fulvestrant 500 mg intramuscularly on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, and every 28 days thereafter.

cohorts.name: Pre-/peri-menopausal women
cohorts.characteristic: Patients who are pre- or peri-menopausal at study entry and receive the LHRH agonist goserelin in addition to their assigned randomized treatment.

cohorts.name: Post-menopausal women
cohorts.characteristic: Patients who are post-menopausal at study entry.

epochs.name: Screening
epochs.description: Occurs within 28 days prior to randomization to determine eligibility.

epochs.name: Active Treatment Phase
epochs.description: Patients receive assigned treatment in 28-day cycles until objective progressive disease, symptomatic deterioration, unacceptable toxicity, death, or withdrawal of consent.

epochs.name: End of Treatment/Withdrawal
epochs.description: Visit performed no later than 4 weeks from the last dose of investigational products.

epochs.name: Post-Treatment Follow-Up
epochs.description: Survival and new anti-cancer therapy information collected every 3 months after treatment discontinuation.
